column5: The Scorpion King broke The Matrix's record ($27.8 mil) for the highest weekend debut in April.

Spider-Man broke Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone's record ($90.3 mil) for the highest weekend debut of all-time, and The Lost World: Jurassic Park's record ($72.1 mil) for the highest weekend debut in May and X-Men's record ($54.4 million) for highest weekend debut for a Superhero film. Spider-Man was the first film ever to gross more than $100 million in 3 days, and had the highest weekend debut of 2002.
Spider-Man broke Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone's record ($57.5 mil) for the highest second weekend gross.

column3: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones
column5: Meanwhile, Spider-Man broke Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace's record ($32.8 mil) for the highest third weekend gross.

column3: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones
